page.title: 07POULTRY FARM LOWER HEATH
page.content: At Whitfields they keep{battery hens. There are usually three{hens}in each cage.They are fed three times a day and have water all the time from 'little nippers'.The food is fed on thin little troughs on conveyer belt. They have eleven houses of battery chickens holding{100000 hens.}5{people work full time and 17 people work part time on the farm.Food is bought from Bibbys in 84 tonnes at a time and it is brought to the farm{7}days a week. Most of the pens have{slatted bases}so the{droppings}fall through the cages to the floor and then it is cleaned out{twice a year.}The food contains {oats,maize, bone and meat meal and {oyster shell.}Each{hen}lays about 300 eggs a year.The eggs are sent to Golden Lay 5 days a week.Hens are bought in at 18 weeks old and after laying for 14 months are{sold to eat.
